bayesim’s implementation¶

Let us assume we want to calculate the thermal conductivity of a bar with length L and cross-sectional area A, subjected to a difference of temperatue . At the hot contact (HC), there will be outgoing thermal flux , which is related to the effective thermal conductivity via Fourier’s law, i.e.

Due to the presence of classical phonon size effects, heat transport is not diffusive, and needs to be calculated by the Boltzmann transport equation (BTE). OpenBTE is based on the mean-free-path formulation of the BTE. The starting point of its derivation is the standard steady-state BTE in the relaxation time approximation
